snippet: A "smog exchange" for Southern California, in which polluting companies would buy credits from clean ones, won preliminary approval on Thursday night.   The 2,800-company exchange is intended to give businesses incentives to meet clean-air goals r...
lead_paragraph: A "smog exchange" for Southern California, in which polluting companies would buy credits from clean ones, won preliminary approval on Thursday night. The 2,800-company exchange is intended to give businesses incentives to meet clean-air goals rather than to order them to comply through specific regulations.
